creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: two sparrows on a bent millet stalk near center; three others fighting over seed on the ground at LL; millet plant at R extending to UC; flowers at R
text: While early ink painting in Japan often featured Zen themes, by the 15th century professional Japanese painters were producing decorative images with seasonal themes that were inspired by imported Ming dynasty academic paintings. Here, the artist relied on "boneless" brushwork (without outlines) to imbue the millet leaves with a believable lightness. The sketchy but naturalistic rendering of the birds brilliantly captures the spirit of their movement.
title: Sparrows among Millet and Asters
